pull.title: depends: build miniupnpc with CMake
pull.body: This picks up one of the changes from #29232, which is a switch to building miniupnpc with CMake. It includes an update to the most recent version of miniupnpc (2.2.7), which means we can drop one patch from that commit, and includes a new patch for a change I've upstreamed https://github.com/miniupnp/miniupnp/pull/721, as well as some suggestions from the previous PR.

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.

issue.title: depends: remove dependency on Darwin libtool
issue.body:
Split out of #21778.

cctools' libtool (and llvm's clone) are unnecessary these days, and were only used (unnecessarily) in miniupnpc and libnatpnp. Both of those projects now have CMake support which eliminates their use.

This PR switches those builds to use CMake, then removes our libtool machinery.

issue.title: depends: build libnatpmp with CMake
issue.body:
This picks up one of the changes from https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/29232, which is a switch to building libnatpmp with CMake. It includes an update to the most recent version of libnatpmp (https://github.com/miniupnp/libnatpmp/commit/f2433bec24ca3d3f22a8a7840728a3ac177f94ba), which includes (https://github.com/miniupnp/libnatpmp/pull/43).

From an initial look I couldn't find any significant difference between the Autotools and CMake produced libs.

issue.title: depends: always configure with `--with-pic`
issue.body:
We currently do this sporadically. Not only amongst packages, but across OS's, i.e sometimes it's done for BSDs/Android, and sometimes not.

Configure with `--with-pic` globally instead. I think this generally makes more sense, and should not have any downsides.

See related discussion in https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/28846#discussion_r1399123100.

issue.title: build: LLD based macOS toolchain
issue.body:
This switches us to using a [LLD](https://lld.llvm.org/) based toolchain for macOS builds.

### Benefits
* Less complicated macOS toolchain.
* Drop `FORCE_USE_SYSTEM_CLANG` in favour of always using the system Clang.
* No longer beholden to Apple releasing it's [source](https://opensource.apple.com/source/) for [cctools](https://opensource.apple.com/source/cctools/), [ld64](https://opensource.apple.com/source/ld64/) & [libtapi](https://opensource.apple.com/source/tapi/).
* No more reliance on third parties to modify those sources for us. i.e [apple-libtapi](https://github.com/tpoechtrager/apple-libtapi), [cctools-port](https://github.com/tpoechtrager/cctools-port) (cctools + ld64).
